author: Veronika Bondarenko
title: Could your travel be affected by the looming storm? Here's what you need to know
text:
Could your travel be affected by the looming storm? Here's what you need to know
The period between Christmas and New Year's Day is traditionally both a
very popular travel period and a time when many parts of the country are at risk of winter storms and other weather-related issues.
At the start of the week, a blizzard that began in midwestern states of Nebraska, Kansas and South Dakota steadily moved east and led to flood advisories and thousands of
flight delays in cities such as New York and Washington, D.C. Related: These are the worst times to travel during the holiday season
Statistics from FlightAware show that over 8,000 flights were canceled across the U.S. on Dec. 26 just as hundreds of thousands of travelers were attempting to get home from Christmas travel. As one of the epicenters of the storm, Denver International Airport was hit particularly hard with over 48% of departing flights delayed and 1% canceled.
Winter storms and flooding hit Midwest but flights are back to normal for now
As Southwest Airlines (
LUV) - Get Free Report operates a major hub out of the city, the airline had a wave of delays and cancelations reminiscent of the much more severe 2022 post-Christmas fiasco.
More Travel:
A new travel term is taking over the internet (and reaching airlines and hotels) The 10 best airline stocks to buy now Airlines see a new kind of traveler at the front of the plane
While the Midwestern storm has since slowed down slightly and allowed airlines to restart flights and redirect travelers to their destinations after brief delays, parts of New York, Washington, D.C. and Philadelphia are currently under flood advisories.
The Flood Watch affects more than 10 million people and, while flights are currently operating as normal, airports are under alert for potential problems if the situation gets worse. As always in the case of bad weather, several airlines reminded travelers to periodically check the status of their flight online to avoid an unnecessary trip to the airport.
For the weekend ahead, storms and more heavy rains are predicted for parts of the Pacific Northwest and California. Los Angeles and San Francisco are on particularly high alert for Saturday, Dec. 30.
"A band of locally heavy rain lasting for several hours in any one spot will press inland to end the week and start the weekend," Accuweather Senior Meteorologist Heather Zehr
said of the forecast. "Rainfall totals will be somewhat limited by the short time frame the precipitation can fall but can still be noteworthy,"
In or heading to the UK? There are bad storms there too
Across the Atlantic Ocean in the United Kingdom, winds of up to 80 miles per hour brought over by Storm Gerrit from the Atlantic pushed International Aviation Group (
BABWF) - https://secure2.thestreet.com/cap/prm.do?OID=033365&ticker=BABWF-owned British Airways to cancel at least 20 flights in London and Bristol airports on Wednesday, Dec. 27. Many of those were flights carrying passengers home from European cities such as Barcelona, Paris and Rome and Aberdeen but many outgoing flights to the same destinations were also canceled.
"We have apologized to our customers for any disruption to their travel plans and our teams are working hard to get them on their way as quickly as possible," a British Airways spokesperson said of the changes.
A video of a Boeing 777 (
BA) - https://secure2.thestreet.com/cap/prm.do?OID=033365&ticker=BA bouncing on the runway while struggling to land in the fog and wind has also been going viral on social media (the pilot landed it safely without any injuries.) [Sign up for our e-News Alerts](/users/newsletters-dc/)

author: Agencia EFE
title: El Vaticano anuncia que el papa Francisco no acudir√° a los actos previstos el pr√≥ximo fin de semana
text:
Saber m√°s
El papa Francisco no asistir√° a la audiencia jubilar prevista para este s√°bado, mientras que en la misa con ocasi√≥n del Jubileo de los Di√°conos del domingo ser√° sustituido por el responsable del dicasterio para la Evangelizaci√≥n, Rino Fisichella, inform√≥ este martes el Vaticano.
Los partes m√©dicos difundidos este lunes explicaron que el cuadro cl√≠nico del papa es ‚Äúcomplejo‚Äù, por lo que se alargar√° su hospitalizaci√≥n en el Policl√≠nico Gemelli de Roma, donde est√° ingresado por ‚Äúuna infecci√≥n polimicrobiana del tracto respiratorio‚Äù, que oblig√≥ a cambiarle la terapia que recibe.
LEE TAMBI√âN:[El papa Francisco padece infecci√≥n en las v√≠as respiratorias y fiebre ‚Äúleve‚Äù, pero est√° ‚Äúsereno‚Äù]
A pesar de su hospitalizaci√≥n, Francisco volvi√≥ anoche a hablar con la parroquia de la Sagrada Familia, la √∫nica iglesia cat√≥lica de Gaza, explic√≥ a los medios italianos su p√°rroco, el sacerdote argentino Gabriel Romanelli.
Por el momento, s√≥lo ha trascendido que el pont√≠fice ha pasado tranquilo su cuarta noche en el Gemelli y en la jornada de hoy se espera una actualizaci√≥n del informe sobre sus condiciones de salud y sobre si est√° funcionando el tratamiento.
‚ÄúEl Santo Padre contin√∫a sin fiebre y con el tratamiento prescrito. Las condiciones cl√≠nicas son estables‚Äù, se indic√≥ en el √∫ltimo comunicado emitido el lunes por la tarde Santa Sede sobre el estado de salud del pont√≠fice, de 88 a√±os.
Previamente, el Vaticano hab√≠a explicado que las √∫ltimas pruebas realizadas mostraban ‚Äúuna infecci√≥n polimicrobiana del tracto respiratorio que ha obligado a modificar a√∫n m√°s la terapia‚Äù de Francisco, cuyo tratamiento ya hab√≠a sido modificado el s√°bado, despu√©s de los primeros ex√°menes.
El Vaticano a√±adi√≥ que el ‚Äúcuadro cl√≠nico complejo requerir√° de una hospitalizaci√≥n adecuada‚Äù, lo que hace prever que el papa permanecer√° varios d√≠as en el hospital y que probablemente se pierda algunos de los m√∫ltiples actos del A√±o Santo, como ya ha sucedido con el de este lunes por el Jubileo de los artistas en los estudios de Cinecitt√† o el Jubileo de los di√°conos de este fin de semana.

author: Skyren Concrete
title: Jason Benson, Owner of Paulding County's Skyren Concrete, Announces Ongoing Work for the Costa Building in Athens, Georgia
text: [Skyren Concrete...](/user/skyren-concrete-construction)on Fri, 01/05/2024 - 14:58 Dallas, Georgia Concrete Construction Company Is Providing the Concrete Portion of Athens-Clarke County‚Äôs Project 32: Costa Building Renovation City, Georgia, Country., January 5, 2024 - /PressReleasePoint/ - Jason Benson, owner of Skyren Concrete Construction, discussed the company's participation in the ongoing project to renovate and make operational the Costa Building, to extend the life and usefulness of the building facility located at 133 East Washington Street, Athens, Georgia. Delivering the included construction project, Skyren Concrete is completing the interior and exterior demolition, grading, storm water runoff, rainwater cistern, adding an additional four (4) floors and penthouse (using cast-in-place concrete), as well as lead paint abatement and encapsulation. "Delivering these essential foundational components of this this renovation of a building built way back in 1910, is a challenge that we were honored to be a part of," said Benson. "What was once a popular ice cream parlor for almost 40 years, will become a fully operational and renovated facility in 2024.‚Äù About Skyren Concrete Construction: Skyren Concrete Construction began business in April of 2019 when it purchased Sa-Fonce Concrete, an industry leading concrete company of over 40 years, established back in 1975. Sa-Fonce has worked with some of the largest developers, companies and general contractors in the United States. Some of these include Duke-Weeks Construction, Ray Weeks Construction, Beers Construction Company, Judwin Properties, Hess Corporation, IKEA, Hartsfield Jackson Airport, Chelsea Construction, Choate Construction, Marriott International, Raco General Contractors, VCC Construction, Ritz-Carlton and Osborne Construction. More About The Project: Funding received for Project 32, also known as the Costa Building Renovation is providing the necessary renovation and capital improvements to extend the life and usefulness of the building facility located at 133 East Washington Street. Those improvements include major interior space and layout revisions, provision of ADA access, upgrades to the mechanical system to bring up to code, energy systems, provision of a fire sprinkler systems and much more. For more information on Skyren Concrete Construction's partnership with Athens-Clarke Country Project 32: Costa Building Renovation, please contact Jason Benson at (770) 410-8418 or SaFonceConcrete@gmail.com Notice Regarding Forward-Looking Statements: This news release contains forward-looking statements, which reflect our views with respect to future events and financial performance. These forward-looking statements are subject to certain uncertainties and other factors that could cause actual results to differ materially from such statements. Readers are cautioned not to place undue reliance on these forward-looking statements, which speak only as of the date the statement was made. We undertake no obligation to update or revise any forward-looking statements, whether as a result of new information, future events or otherwise. We furthermore disclaim any obligation to update any forward-looking statement made herein. Press Contact: Jason Benson Dallas, Georgia 770-410-8418

author: Redacci√≥n Los Andes
title: El arzobispo de Buenos Aires le dej√≥ un fuerte mensaje a Milei: ‚ÄúNuestra gente est√° haciendo un esfuerzo muy grande‚Äù
text: El arzobispo porte√±o Jorge Ignacio Garc√≠a Cuerva, pronunci√≥ un fuerte mensaje criticando la corrupci√≥n, el narcotr√°fico y los incrementos salariales en la pol√≠tica. Esto se di√≥ en el transcurso del Tedeum, en la Catedral de Buenos Aires, ante la presencia del presidente Javier Milei y todo su gabinete. En el inicio de las actividades oficiales del presidente en este 25 de mayo, asisti√≥ al Tedeum en la Catedral de Buenos Aires, en donde el arzobispo Garc√≠a Cuerva pronunci√≥ sus palabras con seriedad ante la situaci√≥n del pa√≠s. El arzobispo Garc√≠a Cuerva inici√≥ sus palabras reconociendo que el agradecimiento a Dios ‚Äúpuede sobar algo ‚Äònaif‚Äô desde aquellos que tienen la panza llena y viven abstra√≠dos de la realidad. El Ted√©um es el canto obstinado de aquellos que no quieren dejar morir la esperanza‚Äù, remarc√≥. ‚ÄúNuestra gente est√° haciendo un esfuerzo muy grande, nosotros no podemos hacernos los tontos. Hay que acompa√±ar con hechos y no solo con palabras ese enorme esfuerzo de nuestra gente‚Äù, expres√≥ el arzobispo ante la situaci√≥n de crisis que vive nuestro pa√≠s. ‚ÄúPor eso siguen doliendo algunas acciones de la dirigencia, divorciada de la ciudadan√≠a de a pie, como los tan comentados autoaumentos de sueldos de algunas semanas atr√°s‚Äù, afirm√≥ Garc√≠a Cuerva. ‚ÄúParecemos tener las manos paralizadas para el encuentro que construye fraternidad, para abrazar a los heridos por la soledad y la tristeza, para ser solidarios con los que menos tienen. Y tambi√©n le pedimos a Dios que nos preserve de las manos manchadas por el narcotr√°fico, las manos sucias de la corrupci√≥n y la coima, de las manos en el bolsillo del ego√≠smo y la indiferencia‚Äù, remarc√≥ el arzobispo ante la mirada de Milei y todo su gabinete. Con las estrofas del himno nacional argentino se dio por finalizado el Tedeum y Garc√≠a Cuerva se aproxim√≥ para saludar al presidente Javier Milei, en donde entablaron una breve conversaci√≥n. El mandatario viajar√° a C√≥rdoba, para continuar con sus actividades oficiales en este 25 de mayo en la Argentina.

author: Meaghan Thurston
title: Research Infosource ranks McGill second in Canada for medical research
text:
Research Infosource ranks McGill second in Canada for medical research Amount of sponsored research funding is a key consideration in determining rankings By Meaghan Thurston
Director, Research Communications December 5, 2024
McGill is Canada‚Äôs No. 2 Research University of the Year in the medical category, according to Research Infosource Inc. The organization ranked McGill fourth overall among research universities in Canada.
Research Infosource‚Äôs rankings are heavily based on universities‚Äô total sponsored research income: money that is invested in research by a funding agency, foundation or corporate partner. In 2023, McGill secured $685 million in research funding from public and private sources, an increase of 13.1 per cent over 2019.
Research Infosource also considers other key measures of research success, including research intensity, which results from dividing research funding by the number of full-time faculty members. McGill‚Äôs research intensity is $380,000, an increase of 12. 8 per cent from 2019.
‚ÄúMcGill‚Äôs success in the Research Infosource 2024 ranking reflects the ambitious and forward-thinking efforts of its researchers across disciplines, and the sustained excellence of its medical school,‚Äù said Dominique B√©rub√©, Vice-President (Research and Innovation). ‚ÄúMcGill is also committed to fostering a research and innovation ecosystem that is among the best in the world, by forging strong connections to industry partners, and building local and global research networks.‚Äù
Research Infosouce announced the results in its publication Canada‚Äôs Innovation Leaders 2024 (CIL2024).
CIL2024 also published a list of Canada‚Äôs Top 40 Research Hospitals , ranking the McGill University Health Centre third.

author: /author/ians/
title: Himachal rain havoc: 34 still missing, rescuers resume search operation
text:
Himachal rain havoc: 34 still missing, rescuers resume search operation
By IANS | Updated: July 3, 2025 09:18 IST2025-07-03T09:13:48+5:302025-07-03T09:18:56+5:30
Shimla, July 3 Rescuers resumed the search operation in Himachal Pradesh‚Äôs Mandi district on the third day on ...
Shimla, July 3 Rescuers resumed the search operation in Himachal Pradesh‚Äôs Mandi district on the third day on Thursday to locate 34 people who went missing after cloudbursts and heavy rain triggered massive landslides and flash floods.
The India Meteorological Department has predicted a moderate flash flood risk in Kangra, Mandi, Hamirpur, Shimla, Sirmaur and Solan districts till Friday.
Amid heavy rain and broken roads, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) team on Wednesday set an example of courage and dedication by carrying a pregnant woman in a palanquin for miles to reach a hospital in the Thunag area in Mandi district.
Torrential rain on Tuesday caused severe flooding, washing away 14 bridges, 148 houses and two shops, resulting in 11 deaths, largely in Mandi district. The death toll could rise as the survival of the missing people after more than 48 hours of disaster is getting dim.
A total of 157 people have been housed in five relief camps, the HP State Emergency Operation Centre said.
Chief Minister Sukhvinder Sukhu on Wednesday visited Syathi village, which is located in the Laungani panchayat in Dharampur in Mandi, where he met families affected by a cloudburst, listened to their woes, shared grief and also reviewed relief and rehabilitation operations.
The district administration has provided assistance of Rs 1.70 lakh as financial aid, ration, tarpaulins and other relief material to each household.
Speaking to the affected families, the Chief Minister said the government stands firmly with all the affected and assured them of all possible assistance.
Recalling the frightening incident, villagers narrated their sorrows and said that the entire village was swept away all of a sudden, and they now do not have a place left to pitch even the tents for shelter.
‚ÄúMany of us narrowly escaped death and were eyewitnesses to the horrifying incident,‚Äù a local resident told the Chief Minister.
Disclaimer: This post has been auto-published from an agency feed without any modifications to the text and has not been reviewed by an editor

author: 20minutos
title: Una tromba de agua imprevista sobre Madrid interrumpe la L3, la L4 y la L5 de Metro e inunda Estaci√≥n del Arte
text:
Una tromba de agua imprevista ha descargado sobre Madrid hacia las 14.45h de este viernes. La tormenta ha durado apenas 10 minutos, pero ese tiempo ha bastado para convertir las calles de la capital en r√≠os, para oscurecer el cielo y hacer bajar moment√°neamente las temperaturas, que en ese momento rondaban los 34¬∫ C.
La descarga de agua ha afectado al servicio de varias l√≠neas de Metro de Madrid . Entre ellas, se ha interrumpido la circulaci√≥n en la l√≠nea 3 entre las estaciones de Palos de la Frontera y Sol "por acumulaci√≥n de agua". Adem√°s, los trenes no efect√∫an parada en la Estaci√≥n del Arte, en la l√≠nea 1 sentido Pinar de Chamart√≠n, tambi√©n por la entrada de agua a los andenes.
Tambi√©n se ha interrumpido la circulaci√≥n de trenes en la l√≠nea 5 entre las estaciones de Latina y Urgel; y en la l√≠nea 4 entre las paradas de Goya y Col√≥n. En todos los casos, el corte se ha producido en ambos sentidos y "por acumulaci√≥n de agua", seg√∫n informa Metro de Madrid en su perfil de la red social X.
Los cortes de servicio de Metro tambi√©n han afectado a la estaci√≥n de Pac√≠fico, en la l√≠nea 6 , donde los trenes no efect√∫an parada. En la superficie de este barrio del sur de Madrid se han formado torrentes de agua en sus calles.
Un chaparroncillo, nada Pac√≠fico, Madrid. pic.twitter.com/Xmumdwppdj
‚Äî Jose4Fun (@FunJose4) August 2, 2024 Precipitaciones solo un 10%... Y est√° diluviando en Madrid... üôà pic.twitter.com/MU1Ck0JDxZ
‚Äî Edu Quintana (@EduQuintana16) August 2, 2024 Seguimos ampliando esta informaci√≥n...

author: Fr Joe Borg
title: Religious quotes and news ‚Äì June 2, 2024
text:
Greatest story ever told
In an op-piece in La Croix International about World Children‚Äôs Day, Nuala Kenny, a paediatrician and a Sister of Charity wrote:
‚ÄúAt every mass, Catholics hear ‚Äòthe greatest story ever told‚Äô, which reveals the depth of God‚Äôs love for us and salvation history. Today, these are among many competing, contradictory, dazzling interactive stories offered to screen-addicted youth, creating unprecedented challenges and opportunities for catechesis. We need to live our belief in the perfection of charity; the essential dignity of all persons made in the image and likeness of God; accept vulnerability as essential to humanity; and salvific suffering.‚Äù
Dreams and fairy tales
Speaking to children after mass in St Peter‚Äôs Square for World Children‚Äôs Day, comedian Roberto Benigni said :
‚ÄúI can see you here, full of dreams. You can feel this buzzing, a hive of dreams, a swarm... Dream! It‚Äôs the most beautiful thing in the world. But I want to tell you a secret. You‚Äôll tell me you know how to dream, you just have to close your eyes, sleep, and dream‚Ä¶ No, no. I‚Äôll tell you a secret ‚Äì to dream, you don‚Äôt close your eyes. You have to open them! You have to open your eyes, read, write, invent. You‚Äôll ask, what‚Äôs the point of fairy tales, with the princesses, the orcs, the dragons? No, fairy tales don‚Äôt tell children that dragons exist ‚Äì they already know that! Fairy tales teach children that dragons can be defeated.‚Äù
Primacy of common good
After UK Prime Minister Rishi Sunak announced a general election, the bishops of England and Wales released a statement urging Catholics to put ‚Äúthe common good before self-interest‚Äù. They said Catholics should be ‚Äúseeking answers which will help the poor, the marginalised, and the vulnerable‚Äù. While admitting Christians can have a different way of looking at politics, the bishops listed several major areas people should be looking at before they vote.
(Compiled by Fr Joe Borg)
